list_definition.definition: a trap for catching an animal.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He snared a couple of rabbits.

list_ex_of_english: Also, of course, snares still have their brutal effects on animals.
On another property 22 giraffes have died in snares.
If we take snaring, the hare may struggle for 12 hours in the trap, which is much more cruel.
Snaring and poisoning are unlawful but a great deal of snaring has been done where there is no proper control.
Clause 3 outlaws the use of snares—except, of course, under special licence.
The dispersion of snares, again unauthorised snares, has undoubtedly been very large.
He also said that the catching of animals in snares was an extremely cruel practice.
In article 12(1)(a) there is reference to "self-locking snares".
